citation.article-title: Butyricicoccus pullicaecorum gen. nov., sp. nov., an anaerobic, butyrate-producing bacterium isolated from the caecal content of a broiler chicken.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Butyricicoccus pullicaecorum sp. nov.
Butyricicoccus pullicaecorum (pul.li.cae.co′rum. L. n. pullus a chicken; L. n. caecum caecum; L. gen. pl. n. caecorum of caeca; N.L. gen. pl. n. pullicaecorum of the caeca of chickens).
Displays the following properties in addition to those described for the genus.
On M2GSC agar after 24 h at 42 °C, colonies are white, smooth, circular and 1–2 mm in diameter.
All five known isolates hydrolyse aesculin and ferment glucose, salicin, sucrose, maltose, xylose, cellobiose, mannose and trehalose.
Urease activity, gelatin hydrolysis and fermentation of mannitol, lactose, arabinose, glycerol, melezitose, raffinose, sorbitol and rhamnose are absent.
The G+C content of genomic DNA of the type strain is 54.5 mol%.
The type strain, 25-3T (=LMG 24109T =CCUG 55265T), was isolated in Ghent (Belgium) in 2007 from the caecal content of a 4-week-old broiler chicken.
